results.title: The "A" list
results.brief_description: A charming digital animation from Australia’s premier centre for animation and interactive media ‘ RMIT AIM. Anyone who has tried to get into the ‘cool’ group at school will relate to this tale about jumping from the highest diving board.

results.title: Rosemary's baby [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Roman Polanski, William Castle and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: A glossy, psychological horror thriller based on Ira Levin’s best seller of the power of witchcraft to destroy lives. Rosemary (Mia Farrow) is the unsuspecting wife whose actor husband (John Cassavetes) becomes involved with a witches coven. Rosemary’s pregnancy precipitates sinister happenings and she soon discovers that not even Dr. Sapirstein (Ralph Bellamy), a respected obstetrician is to be trusted. Sidney Blackmer and Ruth Gordon (who won the Best Supporting Actress Oscar for her performance) are the ghastly neighbours with diabolical designs on Rosemary’s infant. “Rosemary’s Baby” plays on fears even more potent and atavistic than “Psycho.” Co-starring Maurice Evans, Angela Dorian and Patsy Kelly.

results.title: Room service
results.creator_credit: William A. Seiter, Pandro S. Berman and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: The Marx Brothers are penniless Broadway producers, living in a hotel, who are planning a new stage show and are waiting for the finance to come through. As their hotel room becomes packed by members of the cast and the hotel bill escalates, the Marx Brothers devise a number of schemes to avoid eviction by the hotel’s management. Also stars Lucille Ball.

results.title: Room for one more
results.creator_credit: Barry Milligan and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Victoria Templeton interviews couples who have adopted or fostered disabled children in infancy or early childhood. Discusses the joys and issues surrounding caring for emotionally, physically or intellectually disabled children and emphasises the importance of family relationships.

results.title: Ronin [DVD]
results.creator_credit: John Frankenheimer, Frank Mancuso, FGM Entertainment and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Told proficiently, “Ronin” is an action/thriller about a group of renegade criminals for hire, a gang of international professional thieves and killers, without allegiances to country or cause. Deirdre, a mysterious Irish woman, organises a crack team for one high-risk job - to steal a valuable case of unknown contents. The team consists of an ex-CIA officer, a former European intelligence officer, a skilled driver, a top electronics expert and a weapons specialist. The five don’t know, like or particularly trust one another but must work together to get the job done. Director Frankenheimer, somewhat of an expert in the field of car chase sequences, flexes his knowledge here with spectacular rides through the narrow streets of Paris and Cannes. Pyrotechnics, rolling cars, shootouts and a minor love interest make “Ronin” a fairly standard crime movie with some very impressive stunts. International cast includes: Robert De Niro, Natascha McElhone, Stellan Skarsgard, Jonathon Pryce and Jean Reno. Script is by David Mamet (The Winslow boy, Hannibal, State and Main) working under the pseudonym Richard Weisz.
